pr_title: Create a compatibility layer to handle older hive metastores

timeline.message: Implement a compatibility layer for Hive Metastore CLient

timeline.bodyText:
Should this be private?
Also, the second field should be @Nullable I think?
timeline.author: gpang

timeline.bodyText: If the shim was not created, compatibility will be null. Is that ok?
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText: it is ok, because we check for null in the call.
replies.author: yuzhu

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure what this code is doing. Could you explain it, and add a comment?
timeline.author: gpang
gpang

timeline.bodyText: Can you make this message more specific? I'm not sure what the user should do with that message.
timeline.author: gpang
gpang

timeline.bodyText: These info logs could be spammy, since it would log for each invocation of those calls. Should we just cache this info and proactively use the compat method since that decision won't change over time. Then, we can log it when cache the method decision.
timeline.author: gpang

timeline.bodyText: Everything will go through Proxy and reflection now? That will have an overhead for any HMS interaction?
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText:
I am not worried about the performance overhead at all. these calls are going to be dominated by network cost.
according to http://ordinaryjava.blogspot.com/2008/08/benchmarking-cost-of-dynamic-proxies.html, dynamic proxies are about 1.63x of a normal method call, which is almost instant.
replies.author: yuzhu

timeline.bodyText: Is this safe? We are grabbing a field by name, of the hdfs client?
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText:
If this constructor fails, it will be caught at the higher level and we would behave as if there is no compatibility layer.
This reflection allows us to access the  thrift client and issue hive 2.2 compatible requests.
replies.author: yuzhu

replies.bodyText: FYI: other places where reflection is used, there is the risk of failed reflection as well. In those cases, we catch throwable and fall back to the default behavior of the base client.
replies.author: yuzhu

timeline.bodyText: add the fieldName to the message
timeline.author: gpang

timeline.bodyText: Why do we have to set and then unset each time?
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText: you are right, we don't need to unset
replies.author: yuzhu

timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText: i don't think there is a lot of value in caching these objects, mainly because the cost of reflection is going to be minimal compared to the network cost of these thrift calls.
replies.author: yuzhu

timeline.bodyText: Does the name of the method already imply the compatibility shim? If not, can we be explicit in the message that we are using the compatibility shim?
timeline.author: gpang

timeline.bodyText: Thanks for adding the compatibility part, but I think the method name is also useful. Could you add back the method name?
timeline.author: gpang
